text: I'm Daisuke Hyodo of Nissan Motors.
I belong to two departments.
First role is the data science team
in the R&D Department.

And then second role is
the DX Promotion Team
in Global IT department.
We are solving a lot of important project
with AWS cloud services.
Harnessing the power of cloud analytics,
Nissan can make data-informed decisions,
tailor its offering to specific market,
and stay ahead of competitors
by rapidly responding to engagement trend.
The primary advantage of using AWS

to address these challenges
is comprehensive suite

of integrated services, which
are all for rapid innovation,
scalability and cost efficiency.
For example, the Amazon SageMaker to build

and then deploy to our
machine learning models

to predict vehicle parts
failure or maintenance needs.
And then so global data analytics
that Amazon's QuickSight can be supported,
visualize sales data, customer feedback,
and other relevant data

to understand the business
trend deeply and quickly.

So AWS global infrastructure
ensures constant performance

and reliability, enabling
Nissan to seamlessly operate
and innovate across multiple regions
and also reduce time to market

and then response agility
to industry demand.
And all while so benefiting
from the pay-as-you-go pricing model.
